TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SpeechMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the mode of interpretation for speech input.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to specify the speech mode using the <xref:System.Windows.Input.SpeechMode> enumeration.
[!code-csharp[languagemanager#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/languageManager/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#2)] [!code-vb[languagemanager#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/languageManager/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SpeechMode Command = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Speech input is interpreted as commands.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SpeechMode Dictation = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Speech input is interpreted as dictation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SpeechMode Indeterminate = int32(2)
